data.title: Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine
data.meta_description: Located on Thompson's Point just outside of downtown Portland, the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine features a wide variety of interactive exhibits and activities for children and families!
data.text:
Did you know Casco Bay has over 735 islands and exposed ledges? Celebrate local island communities during the MakerSpace Tiny Town Island Takeover! During this self-guided activity, everyone is invited to help design, make, and contribute to the Tiny Town Island community. Will you make a home, a lobster boat, or a lighthouse? A whale or a seagull? The possibilities are endless (and tiny)! We can't wait to see Tiny Town Island grow over the summer months! What will you make? Free choice materials will also be available during each session. MakerSpace is open 2 to 3 times per day. Upon arrival, check our daily specials on the chalkboard for a complete list of activities included with admission and MakerSpace times.

It's a BEE & BUG TAKEOVER in CMTM's MakerSpace! Did you know that there are over 1,000 bug species in Maine? To celebrate all things bee and bug, MakerSpace will offer projects that honor all buzzing, flying, crawling, and jumping bugs in our world. Projects include building a honeybee with recycled & reclaimed materials. Design your pollinator to be little or fluffy, fast or funny. And recreate a real bug or use your imagination to construct your own insect. What will you name it? How will it move? Free choice materials will also be available during each session. Included with Admission. MakerSpace is open 2 to 3 times per day. Upon arrival, check our daily specials on the chalkboard for a complete list of activities included with admission and MakerSpace times.

Join us for a special playtime for anyone who would benefit from a quieter, low-key play session at CMTM. Play Your Way is designed for families affected by Autism, Sensory Processing Disorder, Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, or other challenges. Play Your Way offers families the opportunity to explore the Museum & Theatre, meet other families with similar experiences, and see if CMTM is the right fit for you and your family.

The greatest actor in the world, Wolfgang, is about to perform his solo “Extravaganza” theatre piece-- but is rudely interrupted by a delivery person with a mysterious package. Can you imagine delivering a package to the greatest actor in the world and becoming part of the performance? The delivery person dons a red beanie and the show goes on! The two actors tackle all the characters in this fast, funny and surprising retelling of the classic story. This Red is courageous, clever and talented, thwarting any dinner plans a wolf might have. Like an unexpected package, when you open up a fairy tale, you never know what you’re going to find.

Celebrate World Honeybee Day at CMTM! Honeybees are essential and amazing pollinators. This special insect creates food that humans eat - honey! It takes over 2 million flower visits to create one pound of honey. That must be why honeybees can fly up to 15 mph! On World Honeybee Day, you are invited to build a honeybee during an open MakerSpace session with recycled & reclaimed materials. Design your pollinator to be little or fluffy, fast or funny. Or, explore the science of honeybees by playing a pollination game and learn how honeybees communicate–through dancing!

The Children’s Museum and Theatre of Maine will showcase an array of works by local artists at a 21-plus event complete with food and cocktails, both a live and silent art auction, featuring music and comedy. The proceeds will all go toward its Community Fund, which supports kids and families who face barriers in accessing the facility.

This will be the museum’s second Flying Colors Art Auction Benefit and will be held from 6 to 10 p.m. Friday, May 10.

CMTM has 5 core values: belonging, play, community, curiosity, and trust. Each month, we are shining a light on a different core value and the how and why behind its significance to our organization and the people that make up our CMTM community. This month, we are taking a closer look at Community.

We are thrilled to announce the addition of five dynamic individuals to the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine's (CMTM) Board of Directors and a new executive board consisting of longstanding members who will oversee the executive functions of the organization for the next twelve months.

Planning a trip to the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine (CMTM)? Whether it’s your first or your tenth time visiting, we've got you covered with some tips to help make your time at CMTM as smooth and enjoyable as possible!

We’re Hiring! Join the Children’s Museum & Theatre of Maine as an Exhibits Manager, responsible for overseeing the daily care, operation, and maintenance of Museum and Theatre exhibits and new design, fabrication, and construction. Reporting to the Director of Education and Exhibits, the Exhibits Manager manages the exhibits team, overseeing exhibit remediation design and construction, handling all exhibit maintenance and cleaning operations, and managing future exhibit design and fabrication. Application deadline: September 3, 2024.
